canonical_intents.definition: Highlight deficiencies in the research methodology or experimental design.
canonical_intents.name: Expose_Methodological_Weakness

canonical_intents.definition: Provide explanations to resolve confusion or misinterpretations of the paper.
canonical_intents.name: Clarify_Misunderstanding

canonical_intents.definition: Argue for the originality and significance of the research contributions.
canonical_intents.name: Defend_Novelty

canonical_intents.definition: Provide theoretical justification or support for the proposed methods.
canonical_intents.name: Establish_Theoretical_Grounding

canonical_intents.definition: Acknowledge minor criticisms while reinforcing the main arguments.
canonical_intents.name: Concede_Minor_Point_To_Win_Major

canonical_intents.definition: Ask for more thorough investigation or additional experiments to support claims.
canonical_intents.name: Request_Deeper_Analysis

canonical_intents.definition: Respond to comments regarding the clarity and organization of the paper.
canonical_intents.name: Address_Presentation_Feedback

canonical_intents.definition: Question the uniqueness or significance of the proposed contributions.
canonical_intents.name: Challenge_Novelty

items.rationale: Critiques that highlight methodological flaws are consolidated under this intent.
Responses aimed at resolving confusion are grouped here.
Arguments defending the novelty of the work are categorized under defending novelty.
Theoretical justifications for methods are included in this intent.
Acknowledging minor points while maintaining the main argument fits this intent.
Requests for additional analysis or experiments are grouped here.
Feedback regarding the clarity and organization of the paper is addressed under this intent.
Critiques questioning the novelty of the work are categorized under this intent.
